titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory to the Lucien J. Rode photographs
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-07-15T16:09-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: <date calendar="gregorian" normal="20120806" era="ce">August 6, 2012</date><item>Revised to update encoding by Samira Bozorgi</item>

did.abstract: Depicts General J. J. Pershing, scenes at his headquarters, and activities of American troops elsewhere in France during World War I.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lucien J. Rode photographs, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1959.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biography/Adminstrative History
bioghist.p: Second lieutenant, United States Army Signal Corps; official photographer, Headquarters of General John J. Pershing, Chaumont, France, 1918-1919.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Depicts General J. J. Pershing, scenes at his headquarters, and activities of American troops elsewhere in France during World War I.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. American Expeditionary Forces--Pictorial works.
controlaccess.subject: World War, 1914-1918--Pictorial works.

did.unittitle: 55 prints of General John J. Pershing and of scenes at his headquarters at Chaumont, France.

23 prints of General John J. Pershing with King Albert I and Queen Elizabeth of Belgium; 11 prints of Pershing with Marshal Henri Philippe Petain; 9 prints of Pershing with Field Marshal Sir Douglas Haig; 7 prints of Pershing with President Woodrow Wilson; all taken at Pershing's headquarters at Chaumont, France.

4 prints of General John J. Pershing with Premier Georges Clemenceau, and 1 print of Pershing with marshal Joseph Joffre, all taken at Pershing's headquarters at Chaumont, France 1918-1919; 1 print of Edward, Prince of Wales, 1919; 2 prints of Sergeant Alvin York in France, 1918.
20 prints of U.S. military railway transportation; 10 prints of tanks; 5 prints of military use of carrier pigeons; all taken in France during World War I.
58 prints of U.S. soldiers engaged in a variety of activities in France.
43 prints of miscellaneous scenes related to World War I, mostly taken in France.
